description: From Middle English regencie (cf. regente), from Medieval Latin regentia, from Latin regēns, present participle of regō, surface analysis regent +‎ -cy, compare also  +‎ -ency (“abstract-noun suffix”).

entries.meaning: A system of government that substitutes for the reign of a king or queen when that king or queen becomes unable to rule.
The time during which a regent is in power.
An administrative division ranking below a province in Indonesia.
